text: <@U04EJHVD8FM> Yep, that's done the trick! Thank you very much :saluting_face:

:corgi-wave: :sports_medal: *It's time to showcase your cool UI extensions (custom cards) to the world! - May 28*
Have you recently solved a problem through building a cool UI extension? It's your chance to shout from rooftops about it, and show it to everyone at the upcoming *<https://events.HubSpot.com/events/details/HubSpot-HubSpot-admins-presents-custom-cards/|Admin HUG event focused on custom cards>*. Lots of HubSpot admins will be attending this to learn about custom cards, so if you are a HubSpot solution partner, this is also your chance to show how committed you are in helping our customers extend HubSpot to solve complex problems. *Fill out this form to showcase your extensions (custom cards)* <https://forms.gle/mGYw8CHgbhmuwfWe8>

Update: Fixed the issue with the form - it's open for responses now.
Greetings everyone. How would I go about triggering the "send email" action on a contact record with a pre-populated template, triggered from a button click in a custom card?
I see I can trigger the 1:1 email, but can I set the template or send content to the email? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components/crm-action-components#available-actions>

Hi <@U013TUP19PS>! Thanks for the question!

This is not something we support at this time but are actively looking into supporting it in the future!

Can you tell me a little more about your use case?

Hi <@U05ENUJF7B5> here’s the use case. We’re creating a card to display on a contact record that allows sales reps to search and browse available products in a gallery view. They will be able to “bookmark” certain items, and then the idea is to insert links to those products in a 1:1 email they send to prospects.
